place.name: LLANGYNLLO
place.gazetteerText: LLANGUNLLO, a parish in Newcastle-in-Emlyn district, Cardigan; 3¼ miles NE of Newcastle-Emlyn r. station. Post town, Newcastle-Emlyn, under Carmarthen. Acres, 3,650. Real property, £2,075. Pop., 587. Houses, 130. The property is divided among a few. Bronwydd and Gernôs are chief residences. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. David,s. Value, £148.* Patrons, the Freeholders. The church is dedicated to St. Cynllo, and is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
